RECORD.SN: Ġabra komuni ta' drittijiet u obbligi li jorbtu flimkien lill-Istati Membri tal-Unjoni Ewropea.
Ħadet post il-LAFTA (Assoċjazzjoni Latino Amerikana tal-Kummerċ Ħieles) fl-1981.
Wara r-riforma tar-Regolamenti tal-Persunal tal-Komunitajiet Ewropej, li daħlet fis-seħħ f'Mejju 2004, il-grupp ta' funzjonijiet ammnistrattivi (AD) jieħu post il-kategoriji antiki A u LA.
Patt ta' difiża li jorbot l-Awstralja ma' l-Istati Uniti u New Zealand.
Wara r-riforma tar-regolamenti tal-persunal tal-Komunitajiet Ewropej li daħlet fis-seħħ f'Mejju 2004, il-grupp ta' funzjoni ta' assistenti (AST) jieħu post il-kategoriji antiki B, C u D.
Prinċipju tad-dritt internazzjonali li jimplika li żewġ pajjiżi jew aktar jaċċettaw li jikkooperaw f'qasam speċifiku.
Proċedura istituzzjonali li tuża l-mekkaniżmi tal-ewwel pilastru tal-UE, u mhux il-metodu intergovernattiv użat għaż-żewġ pilastri l-oħra.
Imwaqqfa fl-1975 wara l-fużjoni tal-Organizzazzjoni Ewropea għar-Riċerka Spazjali u l-Organizzazzjoni Ewropea għall-iżvilupp u għall-bini ta' pjattaformi għat-tajran ta' inġenji spazjali.
Maħluqa fl-1958 bl-isem ta' Aġenzija Ewropea għall-enerġija nukleari, l-organizzazzjoni adottat l-isem uffiċjali tagħha biex turi l-appartenenza internazzjonali tagħha.
Farming method which avoids the use of chemical products.
The study of biological data by means of statistical analysis, used to positively determine a person's identity.
Websajt li fih djarju personali jew iddedikat lil suġġett partikolari.
Wara Jannar 2007, l-isem il-ġdid tal-Konfederazzjoni tal-Impriżi Ewropej.

Ftehim ta' kummerċ ħieles stabbilit fl-1992 minn tliet pajjiżi tal-Ewropa ċentrali (iċ-Ċekoslovakkja, il-Polonja u l-Ungerija) u li jgħaqqad pajjiżi msieħba tal-UE u pajjiżi li jixtiequ jsiru membri tal-UE. Fl-1 ta' Jannar 2007, il-membri ta' CEFTA kienu l-Kroazja, l-Eks Repubblika Jugożlava tal-Maċedonja, is-Serbja, Montenegro, l-Albanija, il-Bożnija Ħerzegovina, il-Moldova u l-Kosovo.
Use only for the region which existed until 1995, afterwards use descriptors "Ceuta " or "Melilla ". Ceuta and Melilla are autonomous cities since 13 March 1995.
Uża "CFSP". Is-CFSP twaqqfet mit-Titolu V tat-Trattat dwar l-Unjoni Ewropea (it-tieni pilastru) u tieħu post il-Kooperazzjoni Politika Ewropea (EPC)

L-organizzazzjoni ekonomika intergovernattiva (1949-91) imwaqqfa mill-Unjoni Sovjetika, il-Bulgarija, iċ-Ċekoslovakkja, l-Ungerija, il-Polonja u r- Rumanija. Matul iż-żmien ipparteċipaw ukoll l-Albanija (1949-87), il-Ġermanja tal-Lvant (1950-90), il-Mongolja (1962), Kuba (1972) u l-Vjetnam (1978). Il-Jugoslavja (1964) ħadet sehem bħala membru assoċjat.
Use in association with the institution concerned.
Ewropejizzazzjoni tad-dritt ċivili tal-Istati Membri tal-Unjoni Ewropea.
Stati Afrikani u l-Madagaskar assoċjati mal-KEE bil-konvenzjonijiet ta' Yaoundé I u II. Mill-iffirmar tal-Konvenzjoni ta' Lomé fl-1975, bdiet tintuża l-frażi"pajjiżi tal-AKP".
Obtaining more than half the votes cast.
Act by which a State or international organisation declares its readiness to be bound by an agreement already concluded by other parties.
The acidification of water, soil and vegetation by the deposition of acidifying pollutants (sulphur dioxide, nitrogen oxides and ammonia).
Use for an appeal to an administrative court. Not to be confused with an appeal to an administrative authority.
Control of the legality of Community acts.
Action against the Council or the Commission for refraining to pronounce judgment in matters within their jurisdiction.
Action against States who do not respect the obligations imposed on them by the treaties.

Dissemination to farmers of technical, financial and economic knowledge.

Use this and specific terms for wild animals, either at liberty or in captivity.
Use for any aspect relating to methods and problems connected with animal nutrition. For the feedingstuffs themselves, use the specific term "animal feedingstuffs".

Use for a show or any other public event where animals are used.

Use for national laws, especially American and British. Do not use in the context of Community competition policy$5E use control of restrictive practices instead.
Use for a request to an administrative authority to cancel, change or withdraw a decision taken by the administration. Not to be confused with an action brought before an administrative court.

A period of long-term training substantially carried out within an undertaking and regulated by statutory law or custom according to a contract which imposes mutual obligations on the trainee and the employer.
Acknowledgement by an official authority of the quality of a product or service and of its conformity to standards.
Dealing in commodities, currencies or securities in two or more markets so as to take advantage of any differences in the prices quoted.
The hearing and determination of a dispute, especially an industrial dispute, by an impartial referee selected or agreed upon by the parties concerned.
Action brought by a victim of crime in association with criminal proceedings.
The science and technology of space flight.
Agreement on the international carriage of perishable foodstuffs and on the special equipment to be used for such carriage.

A methodical examination and review carried out to ascertain the general situation of a company or to assess whether a particular activity conforms with legal provisions or the rules of good management.
Cost control: reducing public spending, controlling incomes and prices.
Use for the sale of products from machines. For "automatic teller machine", use the descriptor "electronic banking".
The teaching of the elementary skills that pupils need to become productive citizens capable of civic engagement and sustaining competitive employment.
The minimum food, clothing and housing needs of a human being.

A measurement technique designed to identify the most efficient practices. It provides a series of simple and transparent points of reference which, by means of tests, can help to monitor trends in competitiveness over a period of time, while at the same time offering a base from which to set targets and adopt the plans needed to attain them.
Use for documents which cover the entire range of products, otherwise use a more specific descriptor.
Ethical aspects of techniques involving human intervention in biological processes.
Branch of industry using biotechnology at an industrial and commercial level.
The study of the influences exerted on living organisms by climate.
Direct or indirect transformation of solar energy by living beings.
Biological diversity within and across species, and within terrestrial or aquatic ecosystems.
All forms of energy originating from the transformation of biomasses.
Gaseous substance resulting from the decomposition of organic matter.
All organic matter which forms living beings, animal or vegetable.
Branch of technology aimed at cultivating micro-organisms, animal and vegetable cells and their components.
A biotope is a homogeneous area of similar ecology which constitutes the habitat of a specific animal and vegetable community.
Situation in certain countries where the political scene is dominated by the struggle for power between two political movements. Not to be confused with two-party system.
Use only for the control of persons and their luggage when crossing a frontier.
Scale comprising of minimum and maximum limits within which prices can vary.
Emigration of qualified persons to a country or region which offers them better working conditions.
Videography where messages are broadcast by a television network.
A client program which allows users to look for and read hypertext documents on the world wide web and navigate between them.
Principle under which appropriations must be used for the specific purpose laid down in the budget.
Stocks of commodities held to reduce fluctuations in world commodity prices.
A group of companies set up to obtain more favourable conditions from suppliers than would be possible if each acted individually.
System using a network of cables to broadcast audio or visual programmes to a large number of users.
Use for documents which deal with all of these countries.
Association of independent companies with similar activities, formed for the purpose of limiting or eliminating competition in a particular market.
A company's gross cash flow is its net profit before charging depreciation$5E the net cash flow consists of retained profits plus depreciation.
Occasional or irregular work during peak periods or when other employees are absent.
These come from the application of the common customs tariff to imports from third countries
A chemical compound occurring naturally in fibrous products such as cotton and kapok, and used in the manufacture of paper, rayon, cellophane, etc.
Parity of a national currency against the ECU, and via the ECU against other national currencies, around which its value may fluctuate within certain limits.
Method of adding sugar to wine.
Having an effect equivalent to that of customs duties.
inorganic fertiliser
Various measures whose purpose is to improve conditions for children in society.
Includes, in addition to the price of the goods themselves, the cost of transport and insurance to the port of destination.
The science of danger, which studies natural, technological or domestic risks and their prevention.
International convention regarding the transportation of travellers and luggage by rail.
Refusal to obey laws considered as unjust by means of non-violent protest.
Not to be confused with action to establish liability on the part of an administration.
In civil, commercial and social matters.
Worker who carries out a remunerated activity in violation of the law.
The production, by way of vegetative reproduction, of a group of cells or organisms which are genetic duplicates and thus genetically identical to the original stock or ancestral cell.
Joint coverage of a large risk by a number of insurers under a single contract, each insurer being liable for a portion of any claims.
A text which is binding on States or private persons and lays down international standards simplifying the drafting and application of national policies, laws and regulations in specific fields.
A financial instrument intended to reduce the gap in the economic performances of the Member States, thereby promoting economic and monetary union.
A written agreement on working conditions drawn up between one or more workers' organisations on the one side and one or more employers' organisations on the other.
Process in which representatives of employers and employees negotiate with a view to establishing a collective agreement.
Tariff and statistical nomenclature applied to the external trade of the Community and to the trade between Member States.
The dispatch of goods using several means of transport, the greatest distance possible being covered by rail, inland waterway or sea, and the shortest by road.

Matul iż-żmien ipparteċipaw ukoll l-Albanija (1949-87), il-Ġermanja tal-Lvant (1950-90), il-Mongolja (1962), Kuba (1972) u l-Vjetnam (1978). Il-Jugoslavja (1964) ħadet sehem bħala membru assoċjat.

Market where the bulk sale and purchase of commodities (wool, coffee, cocoa) take place, often for future delivery.
Agreement under which the main exporting countries and the main importers of a commodity undertake to respect a regulation relating to the international trade in this product.
Do not restrict usage to the EC.
Established by the Treaties to exist alongside the Community institutions.

An action undertaken by the Community to resolve problems connected with the implementation of Community policies on a regional scale, or to resolve those problems which are common to certain categories of region.

A legal measure used where the Community institutions are called upon to state a view on a current situation or particular event in the Union or the Member States. In some cases, they prepare the way for subsequent, legally binding acts, or are a prerequisite for the institution of proceedings before the Court of Justice.

Preferential treatment given to goods produced in the European Community so as to encourage a Member State to buy from its partners rather than on the world market.
Community support for cultural and sporting events given in order to promote its image. Not to be confused with financial aid granted in connection with Community programmes or policies.

Policy aimed at defending the specific interests of consumers by recognising their fundamental rights and by aiming to reduce inequalities, fight against disloyal practices, promote health and safety and improve the standard of living in general.
A type of society where growth in production results in a proliferation of consumer goods and consequently in the creation of new needs and desires.
Strip of water extending beyond the territorial waters at a distance of less than 24 miles from the coast.
Irregular submarine margin of a continent over which territory the coastal State has sovereign rights to extract resources.

An economy in which the State intervenes but does not impose centralised planning.

The branch of astronomy concerned with the evolution and structure of the universe.

European cooperation in scientific and technical research.
Use for documents which deal with all of these countries.

Unlawful acts in general.

Prices are no longer guaranteed if production exceeds a certain predetermined level.
Waste which must be handled with particular care in view of the possible risks of injury to humans, animals or the environment.
The recruitment by various methods of employees from one company to another, often rival, company.
Instructing the general public in the basic principles of health and hygiene.

The objective of help for victims is to inform victims and their families of their rights, advise them on procedures to be taken and offer them psychological support at all stages of the legal process.
The situation of a person who cannot be considered as unemployed since he is not looking for work. He is therefore no longer counted as part of the labour force.
Independent political force of the right or left which forms coalitions with the right or left.
Boorish, often violent behaviour by noisy, rough groups of persons, sometimes causing damage to property in public places or at sporting events.
A unit for the population census, every individual or group of individuals residing in the same dwelling.
The study of man's geographical distribution and spatial organisation.
Use for general studies, otherwise choose a more specific descriptor.
The total construction work involved in setting up a hydroelectric plant.
The linking of multimedia to web documents; the integration of text, images, sound, graphics, animation and video through hyperlinks.
Pages of computer text which are authored in software so as to allow extensive cross-referencing between related sections of text and associated graphic material.
The image which the general public has of an institution, person or service.
The political, economic or cultural domination of one nation by another.
A duty imposed on imports of products so as to bring prices to a level equal to those on the domestic market.
Price fixed by the State.
Training paid for and given during active work periods.
Disability due to an occupational accident or disease.
Incorporation into the budget of particular items of revenue and expenditure.
Use for income of individuals or undertakings, otherwise use national income.
The holder of an elective office is forbidden to hold another office considered detrimental to the former.
Uniform trade terms formulated by the International Chamber of Commerce.
Potential and more-or-less predictable danger which can arise at an industrial site, with immediate serious consequences for the adjacent population, property or environment.
Mechanisms which ensure that industries of different countries complement each other in an attempt to achieve economic integration.
To be applied to a branch of industry or at an inter-industrial level. Do not use for the internal reorganisation of a company.
Research, the aim of which is to improve methods of production or to develop new products.
Sociology applied to the world of work, e.g. the workplace as a social system, occupational status, racial and intergroup relations in the enterprise, etc.
The entire spectrum of worldwide, interactive data transmission and reception, including internet, interactive television and similar networked media.
Only to be used for documents of a very general nature, otherwise choose a more specific descriptor.
Transport movement where the points of arrival and departure are situated within the territory of the same State.
Grant for young farmers who are setting up a farm for the first time.
Private body whose activities are recognised as being in the public interest.
Use for Community bodies.
The application of telematics in transport.
Flow of goods and services between different industries.
Videography where a telecommunications network transmits the requests of users and the messages received in reply.
Group capable of exercising pressure on a decision taken at government level.
Technology which can improve the productivity of traditional methods without requiring the capital or educational training necessary for advanced technology.
Includes treaties, codes of conduct, resolutions, plans of action and declarations of inter-governmental organisations. Use in association with organisation concerned.
Use in association with country concerned.
ILO governing body, made up of national delegations representing government, workers and employers.
Effects of international law, particularly of treaties, on the national law of a State.
For the names of international organisations refer to field 76.
International obligation to repair damages caused to foreigners as a result of acts contrary to international law.
Measures taken against a State which has violated international law.
An organisation or business offering public access to the Internet.
Use only to index documents which refer to the creation, development and maintenance of internet sites, not to indicate a list of sites.
Intervention of the State in certain economic or social matters.
Use for relations between Member States. Not to be confused with relations between a State and the Community.
Internal telecommunications and computer-network system designed to be used exclusively within a particular organisation. The protocols and technologies used are based on Internet technology.
Outward investment in another country.
Processing of imported goods on which no duty is paid provided the finished product is re-exported.
Method of preserving foodstuffs by the use of rays.
The political principle or practice of a country not to participate in international affairs.
Ability of an individual to change his/her position or rank within a profession or to change occupation.
A work contract which guarantees a long period of employment.
System in which an employee agrees to work fewer hours, resulting in a reduction of salary, in order to permit an unemployed person to work.
Use for a new measure adopted by the Council within the framework of EU intergovernmental cooperation. Not to be confused with Community action.
Refers to committees whose French title contains the expression 'comitÚ paritaire'.

Use where Member States hold consultations in the Council on matters regarding European political cooperation and, since the signing of the Treaty on European Union, on matters regarding cooperation in the fields of law and home affairs and common foreign
A company set up jointly by two or more parent companies which themselves remain legally and financially independent.
Cooperation between the judicial bodies of different States, which may take the form of mutual assistance or the recognition and enforcement of judgments.

Knowledge management involves the identification and analysis of available and required knowledge assets and knowledge asset related processes, and the subsequent planning and control of actions to develop both the assets and the processes so as to fulfil organisational objectives.

The relaxation of labour regulations, which are considered to be one of the main impediments to growth and job creation. Includes flexibility regarding wages, working hours, the organisation of work and also the use of manpower through flexible job and location practices.
Refers to the ability of individual workers to move around within the labour market. Not to be confused with free movement of workers.
Collective relations between employers and employees. For individual relations, use "personnel administration".
Situation where the number of job-seekers is inferior to the demand.
Standards concerning employment and working conditions, which are set out in collective agreements or laid down under labour law and labour regulations.
Body established with a view to acquiring land or farms for sale which are intended to be re-assigned after possible development.
Refers to the division and ownership of land.
Complete reform of the land system and conditions of agricultural production in order to eliminate obstacles to economic and social development.
Use for matters relating to the legal bond between two or more persons, whereby one of them may compel the other to fulfil an obligation.
Leave granted to take part in a political campaign or to carry out the duties of an elected representative.
Assistance granted to persons in need to enable them to exercise their legal rights.
Cooperation between States aimed at drafting joint regulations or harmonising legislation.
Handing over to the appropriate institutions of several free copies of a literary or audiovisual work on or after their publication.
Use to index documents concerning the linguistic and legislative qualities of a law.
Period during which a legislative assembly exercises power.
A principle whereby a State must be liable and make reparations for loss and damage caused to individuals by breaches of Community law.

A health care directive that tells others how a person would like to be treated if they lose their capacity to make decisions about health care. The term living will is often used when a person is planning for their last illness, but a health care directive can be made in any circumstances.
Constitutes a local territorial area. Not to be confused with the descriptor "local government".
Use only for local administrations. Not to be confused with the descriptors "regional and local authorities" and "local authority".
Closure of a factory by an employer in order to force workers to accept certain working conditions.
The branch of economics concerned with aggregates, such as national income, consumption, and investment.
Systematic evaluation of management methods by teams from either within or outside the organisation.
System in which defined data are collected, processed and communicated to assist those responsible for the use of resources.
General demand for labour or demand in particular industries, sectors or economies.
Merchant shipping between neighbouring ports or Community ports.
Total value at current market prices of all the issued shares of a company or of the shares of all the companies listed on a market.
Use specific terms.
Annual reference period for the fixing of farm prices.
Communication by means of press, radio, television etc.
Having an effect equivalent to that of customs duties or quantitative import restrictions.
Intervention by a third party to resolve a conflict which could not be settled by normal administrative procedure.

Pajjiżi fin-nofsinhar tal-Mediterran, tal-Lvant Qrib u Nofsani, assoċjati ma' l-Unjoni Ewropea fil-kuntest tal-partenetarjat Ewro-Mediterranju. Sa llum, il-pajjiżi terzi Mediterranji huma l-Marokk, l-Alġerija, it-Tuneżija, l-Eġittu, l-Iżrael, il-Ġordan, l-Awtorità Palestinjana, il-Libanu, is-Sirja kif ukoll it-Turkija.
Arrangement under the European Monetary System for granting loans for two to five years to Member States facing serious balance-of-payments difficulties.
Use for all international organisations except the European Communities.
The various techniques used to render a product or a service as attractive as possible to the consumer.
The study of the earth's atmosphere, especially of weather-forming processes and weather forecasting.
Enterprise with fewer than 10 employees.
The branch of economics concerned with particular commodities, firms, or individuals and the economic relationships between them.
Use for documents which cover the entire range of products, otherwise use a more specific descriptor.
Lowest level which stocks of any item should be allowed to reach in the course of normal business.
Use for documents which cover the entire range of products, otherwise use a more specific descriptor.
The simultaneous growing of various crops in different areas of the same farm.
Intermediate stage between owner farming and tenant farming.
Company owned partly by the government or a public body and partly by private-sector investors.
The way in which a society goes about producing goods and services, consisting of the forces and relations of production.
Charge on imports or exports of agricultural products introduced to offset the difference between actual exchange rates and "green" rates and thus prevent distortions of competition.
Short-term Community financing intended to meet financial requirements resulting from a temporary deficit in the balance of payments.
A market in short-term financial claims, e.g. bills of exchange, Treasury bills, interbank money and discount house deposits.
All means of payment which can be used in a given country.
Means of payment readily available without the need to move funds.
Kunċett li ma jeżistix f'Malta jew fl-ilsien Malti.
Expression of disapproval or criticism addressed to the government by a parliamentary assembly.
Agreement concerning the international textile trade.
Integration of sound, images (possibly animated) and text on a single support.
One person legally holding several offices.
System of accounting used to compile national accounts. Not to be confused with public service accounting.
The aggregate earnings of labour and property which arise from the current production of goods and services by the nation's economy.
An area of countryside for public use designated by a national government as being of notable scenic, environmental, scientific or historical importance.
Use in association with country concerned.
Person connected to a State either by nationality or sovereignty. If necessary, use in association with the State concerned.
A party which extols national pride, sometimes possessing xenophobic or isolationist tendencies.
Contract awarded at the discretion of an administrative body after a preliminary competition among potential contractors.
The state of a nation which voluntarily refuses to become involved in an international conflict.
Cancelled in 1987 and replaced by the Combined Nomenclature.
Use in a general sense, not in relation to an identified noise source.
Use for noise pollution from a known source, such as a vehicle, a machine, a discotheque,a motorway or an airport.
Refusal by a nation to align itself to one or other of the major powers.
Parliamentarian who does not belong to any political group.

Benefit awarded to needy persons who do not possess sufficient funds to maintain themselves and who have either never paid social security contributions or have not paid them for long enough to receive the benefits normally due to a wage-earner.
Activities or programmes organised outside of the school system but directed towards precise educational objectives.
Weapons specifically designed to incapacitate combattants and equipment, while at the same time minimising the risk of death, permanent injury and irreversible damage to property and the environment.
A Member State which has not yet adopted the single currency, either intentionally or because it does not yet meet the conditions.
Work which is other than full-time and permanent, including part-time, evening and weekend work, fixed-term work, teleworking and outwork.
Use for documents which deal with all of these countries.
The field of medicine in which radio nuclides are used for diagnosis or therapy.
International control of the transfer and utilisation of nuclear weapons.
The branch of psychology concerned with the working environment and personnel management.
To be used for a country or within an institution.
Government by a small group of people
Situation in which a market is effectively controlled by a limited number of sellers.
Situation in which a market is effectively controlled by a limited number of buyers.
Use also for Community bodies.
Clause allowing a Member State to refrain from or to delay the application of certain provisions of an agreement.

The process of optical character recognition consists in the conversion, by means of a scanner or machine which recognises letters and characters through a mechanism of electronic conversion using a light source, of a numeric image into text, which can then subsequently be modified and processed by means of a word-processing programme.
Product produced in a given country$5E where more than one country is involved in the manufacture of a product, it is an originating product of the country where processing last took place.
Flow of liquid assets abroad.
Law outlining general principles but allowing the government to use its parliamentary power to develop them further.
Outsourcing is when a company purchases a product or process from an outside supplier rather than producing in house.
Temporary export of goods for further processing or repair under special customs arrangements.
For names of countries and territories, see microthesaurus 7241 overseas countries and territories.

The tax revenue allocated to the European Union to finance its expenditure, which must not exceed the Community GNP ceiling. Own resources comprise agricultural duties, customs duties, a VAT resource, sugar and isoglucose levies and GNP contributions.
Cultivation of an agricultural area by the landowner himself.
Sexual desire directed towards children.
Treatment which relieves or suppresses the painful symptoms of an illness without having an effect on the illness itself.
Use for the parliamentary body of an international organisation.
If necessary, use in association with the area of activity concerned.
Use for national and regional parliaments or assemblies.
Employment with monthly working hours which are shorter than those normally worked by full-time employees.
A Member State which has adopted the single currency.
Company competing in the production of goods and services, the object of which activity is to maintain or create employment.
Initiative aimed at improving stability and security in Europe by strengthening ties between NATO and the countries of Central and Eastern Europe or other States belonging to the CSCE.
The gradual impoverishment of the population of a region or of a social class as the result of major changes in the economy of a region or country.
A special fee is required in order to receive programmes.
Area free from nuclear arms or foreign military installations.
Any substance used for the abnormal enhancement of an individual's physical or mental performance.
All persons in active employment, discounting the unemployed.
Use for documents which cover the entire range of products, otherwise use a more specific descriptor.
The creation, editing or publishing of pictures by means of a computer.
An area of land planted with crops, usually on a large scale.
Product used to alter the mechanical and thermal properties of certain solid substances in order to increase their flexibility, lower their breaking temperature and render them easier to shape.
A direct vote by the qualified electors of a State regarding some important public issue.

This term originated in the 1980s when the socialist French President, Franþois Mitterrand, was forced to adopt a power-sharing solution when a government of the right was elected. The term is now also used to describe similar situations in other countries.
Use to describe the politics of one country, a group of countries or a region at a specific time.
Concerns countries or regions whose status is controversial.
The principle by which costs of anti-pollution measures are chargeable to the party responsible for the pollution.
Marine pollution caused by waste from the land or from inland waterways.
The adaptation of scientific and technical knowledge to make it accessible to non-specialists.

Wrapping of a product, in the absence of the purchaser, in such a way that the amount of product has a fixed value in volume or mass which is chosen in advance.
Community law takes precedence over any provision of the law of Member States which is contrary to it.
A Community trade agreement containing tariff provisions more favourable than those of GATT.
Form of voting in which candidates are numbered in order of preference by the voter.
Use for equipment subjected to a positive or negative pressure compared to atmospheric pressure.
Instrument for measuring the movement of prices.
Use for national agricultural prices. Within the framework of the CAP use farm prices.

Communitisation means transferring a matter which, in the institutional framework of the Union, is dealt with using the intergovernmental method (second and third pillars) to the Community method (first pillar).

Principle in accordance with which the Commission, pursuant to the Amsterdam Protocol, proposes measures which are proportional to the aim pursued, allowing each Member State the largest possible margin for realising these measures on a national scale.
Principle by which the Community only takes action if the objectives can be more readily achieved at its level than at the level of the Member States.
Aid provided by churches, foundations, etc.
The rights and immunities enjoyed by members of most legislative bodies, such as freedom of speech, freedom from arrest in civil cases during a session, etc.
Use for documents which cover the entire range of products, otherwise use a more specific descriptor.

Procedure which allows non-Community goods to be processed without being subject to import duties or to trade policy measures. Products resulting from this processing are put on the market but are subject to the usual import duties.
Voluntary grouping of farmers involved in a particular type of production in the same area.
Rate of output which a worker is expected to maintain in order to receive a specific wage. Do not confuse with "labour standard".
Associations of certain professions which are not included in the trade union movement.
Partnership established for the exercise of certain liberal professions.
The particular knowledge and skills required of a person in order to carry out his job.
Method of teaching involving computers.
Use for any campaign aimed at promoting the idea of European integration.
Official publication of a new law, thereby putting it into effect.
Electoral system in which each party is represented in proportion to the numerical strength of the vote it receives.
The examination and evaluation of the possible consequences of the introduction of new technologies.
Clause which authorises contracting parties to ignore certain provisions of an agreement if there is a threat to their essential interests.
Use for a worker's personal protective equipment and for safety devices on machines and equipment.
Sum set aside in the accounts to provide for certain anticipated losses or expenditure.
Use for State authorities or bodies and for local and regional authorities, taken as a whole.

Use for campaigns launched to inform the general public. Combine with the field in question or with the name of the institution if the campaign refers to the image which the general public has of this institution.
Contract binding a public body and a third party with a view to supplying work or services.
Liabilities of central government and other public bodies to individual creditors.
The law applied to economic cases brought by public persons.
Action brought before a criminal court by the public prosecutor's department with a view to passing an appropriate sentence on the perpetrator of a crime.
Use for the body providing a service. Not to be confused with the descriptor "services of general interest".
This requires more difficult conditions to be met than with an absolute majority, for example a two-thirds majority.

A group of workers, performing similar work and trained to identify and solve problems, who volunteer to make recommendations relating to the improvement of productivity, quality, work morale, etc. in an undertaking.
Examination of industrial products at various stages of manufacture so as to ensure conformity to standards.
Sector of the economy regarding intellectual services, education, consultancy, information, research.
Minimum number of participants that must be present at a meeting to make its transactions valid.
The act by which a State confirms an agreement or treaty, thus internationally binding itself to such an agreement.
Use to indicate a change of job within the same company as a result of redeployment or promotion.
Mutual recognition of certificates and other documents confirming completion of vocational training.
Document issued by an international organisation which does not imply any legal obligation. Use in association with the organisation concerned.
Repaying of a debt at a fixed rate or by annual instalments.
Substitution of one agricultural activity for another.
Operation in which a central bank discounts a bill presented by another bank which has already discounted it.
Vote by the general community to accept or reject a measure proposed by the government.
Policy designed to give new impetus to economic activity which is in a state of decline or stagnation.
The refusal of a producer or distributor to sell goods or services.
The position of the regions and their influence on the various European policies.
Covers various types of territorial area. Not to be confused with the descriptor "local government".
The study of the characteristics of a region and their economic, ecological or social implications.
In a regional context; not to be confused with "autonomist party".
Act of general significance issued by an authority other than parliament.
Arrangement under which an insurer passes on to other parties all or part of a risk he has assumed$5E this is not double insurance but a means of spreading large risks.
An employment-maximising enterprise set up to provide work for unemployed people.
Return to the job market after a long period of absence due to maternity leave, children's education, military service, imprisonment, etc.
Political and economic relations between East and West Germany.
Not in the sense of theological debates.
All techniques used to determine the physical and biological features of objects by measures carried out at a distance without material contact with the object concerned.
The official annulment or rescindment (as of a law or sentence) from operation or effect.
Special rate for conversion between the ECU and a national currency for the purposes of farm prices, deviating from the normal exchange rate.
Use for the requisitioning of staff in order to provide a minimum service in the event of disputes or strikes.
Currency which countries are willing to hold as part of their foreign-exchange reserves.
Amounts set aside by a business in anticipation of future liabilities.
The study of the mechanical properties of materials and the conditions under which they resist or deform when used.
Document issued by an international organisation, the legal implication of which may vary. Use in association with the organisation concerned.
Use in opposition to wholesale price, otherwise use consumer price.
Return of a migrant to his/her birthplace or last place of residence.

Every person has the right to participate in economic, social, cultural and political development, and to contribute to it and benefit from it. Human rights and basic freedoms are an integral part of such development.
Every person has the right to work and to exercise a profession freely chosen or accepted.
Study of a sample representative of a population so as to determine characteristics.
Use for indexing global satellite systems used for navigation and positioning.
Town which is politically and economically dependent on another town.
Computer peripheral for digitising text and image.
Agreement aimed at the gradual abolition of controls on persons at the internal frontiers of the Community.

Work that, because of its nature or of factors peculiar to the industry in which it is performed, is available, at approximately the same time or times every year, for part or parts only of the year. This situation occurs particularly in agriculture and tourism.
Employment rate variations linked to the time of year.
The branch of geology concerned with sedimentary rocks and deposits.
Money used for the initial investment in a project or startup company, for proof-of-concept, market research, or initial product development.
The right of a nation or people to determine its own form of government without influence from outside.

The practice of an organisation or group of like organisations voluntarily selecting, adopting and enforcing rules to produce compliance with a defined level of behaviour, without direct legislative interference by government.
Relationship between the production and consumption of a product within a given area.

Acts attributable to the State whereby a public authority entrusts to a third party û by means of a contractual act or a unilateral act with the prior consent of the third party û the total or partial management of services for which that authority would normally be responsible and for which the third party assumes the risk.

Covers market and non-market services which the public authorities class as being of general interest and subject to specific public service obligations. Not to be confused with the descriptor "public service", which refers to the body providing a service.
Incentive to non-cultivation of land so as to limit agricultural production.

Group of leaders of the Opposition, each assigned to watch a major government department so as to challenge government policy in that field. If government changes, members may be appointed to those departments they have shadowed.
Arrangement under which the landowner lets his land in return for part of the produce.
Formality which acknowledges agreement on the text of a treaty but which does not normally bind the State.
A container, often cylindrical in shape, for the storage of grain.
The branch of forestry that is concerned with the cultivation of trees.
Professional qualifications which no longer meet the demand or which are no longer valid, owing to technological change, for example. This situation can be remedied through vocational retraining.
The systematic evaluation of an organisation's social impact in relation to standards and expectations. Use the descriptor "humanisation of work" for questions concerning the quality of life at work.
Section of the budget concerned with social matters (pensions, health, education, family benefit etc.).

Incorporates those basic labour standards on which developed and developing countries agree. These standards apply to the right to organise trade unions, the right to collective bargaining, the banning of slavery and forced labour, non-discrimination and the minimum working age.

The practice of taking advantage of lower labour costs in certain countries (owing to lower social security and other contributions), thus attracting business away from other countries and thereby creating unfair competition.

That part of the economy which is neither private nor public, but consists of constituted organisations (such as cooperatives, community businesses, social firms and self-help groups), with voluntary members and boards of directors or management committees, undertaking activities for the benefit of the community.
The movement of an individual or group from one social class or status to another.
Use for any collective action promoting greater social justice.

The Social Policy Agreement has been incorporated into the EC Treaty by the Treaty of Amsterdam. The Social Policy Agreement sets out the EU's social policy objectives, whereby special emphasis has been put on equal opportunities and the fight against social exclusion.
The transfer of income and public service provision to individuals and social groups without payment so that they can enjoy an improved standard of living.
Energy which is non-pollutant, whether renewable or not.
Branch of soil science concerned with the chemical composition, properties and reactions of soils.
Incorporation of substances into the soil to improve its physical and chemical properties.
Form of education for pupils with special needs, such as the mentally or physically handicapped.
Leave, other than annual leave, granted for family reasons, change of residence, training, etc.
The direct or indirect funding by persons or organisations of social, cultural, sporting or other activities or of their broadcasting.
Market in which goods are sold for immediate delivery.
System of loans or gifts made to ACP States in order to remove the effects of market fluctuation and production risks upon agricultural export receipts.
Tax on legal documents etc., the payment of which is certified by the attaching or impressing of official stamps.
A level of subsistence or material welfare of a community, class, or person. Not to be confused with "Cost of living".
A family into which one or both of the adult partners bring children from a previous relationship.

Set of economic policy measures aimed at correcting a country's major imbalances by providing it with structures, operating mechanisms and a price system close to those currently in force in the world market, all aimed, in the long term, at re-orientating production and investment decisions.
Financial instruments used by the European Commission to promote the economic and social cohesion of the European Union.
Unemployment resulting from changes in the structure of the economy, technical progress, re-siting of industries or changes in the composition of the work force.
Budgets annexed to the general budget for certain public bodies (e.g. Post Office) which are not independent legal entities but have a degree of financial autonomy.
A company controlled directly or indirectly by another company, known as the parent or holding company.
An urgent court hearing to stop a situation which is against the law.
Tariff which favours national carriers (prohibited without the authorisation of the Commission).
Development which allows present needs to be satisfied without compromising the capacity of future generations to satisfy their needs too.
An official arrangement between the central banks of two countries for standby credit to exchange holdings of each other's currencies.
Limit set on the quantity of goods which may be imported at a reduced or zero rate of duty.
Geographical area inside of which there is a uniform transport price.
Reduction or minimisation of tax liability by lawful means.
Reduction or minimisation of tax liability by unlawful means.
Paid by the employer as a proportion of the wages paid.
Tax owed by physical persons on their total income, calculated by adding earned income and investment income.
Incorporates research activites, centres of higher education and advanced industries.
The transfer from one country to another of the knowledge, manufacturing techniques and equipment necessary for the production of goods.
Use specific terms.
The transmission, broadcasting or reception of signals, sounds, messages or information of any nature by electric means, e.g. wire, radio or other electromagnetic systems.
All services, other than the normal telephonic and telegraphic services, which use teleinformatic techniques and which can be received by users of a telecommunications network.
Text transmission service enabling the various functions of text processing to be carried out remotely.
Work carried out at a distance using telecommunication services or computers.
Entry for a limited period, with suspension of customs duties, of goods intended for re-export.
Work which requires the recruitment of a person for a fixed length of time.
Arrangement under which a landowner lets land to a farmer in return for an annual payment not dependent on the yield from the farm.
A measure of a country's trading prospects based on the ratio of an index of export prices to an index of import prices.
A part of a country entirely surrounded by foreign territory.
Strip of water between coastline and open sea having a maximum width of 12 miles.
The various measures taken to detect, forecast or stimulate the needs of consumers and subsequently adapt production and marketing.
Western part of the island of Timor which has been part of Indonesia since 1945.
Use for the legal or illegal trade in any part of the human body or any product derived therefrom.
An association of employees, usually not limited to a single company, formed to protect or improve incomes and working conditions by collective bargaining with employers or employer organisations.
If necessary, use in association with imports or exports.
A permit that allows a certain source to emit a specified volume of some pollutant.
Use in association with the type of transport concerned.
The interconnection and interoperability of national transport, telecommunications and energy networks aimed at creating an area without internal frontiers.
Method used by companies to export capital by charging their subsidiaries greatly increased prices for products supplied by the parent company.
Act of passing through a country when the points of arrival and departure are situated outside this country.
Transport potential of an undertaking.
Study of transport requirements and the most appropriate ways in which to meet them.
Fixed routes and facilities used in transport. Use in connection with the mode of transport concerned.
Sum demanded not only for transport from one place to another but possibly also for certain additional services.
Permission to cross customs territory or to convey imports to a customs warehouse or customs clearing centre without fulfilling customs formalities at the border.
Transport price fixed in advance according to a systematic table.
An exchequer bill payable at short notice.
Relationship between the landowner and the farmer who works the land.
Sector of the economy based on illicit working or illegal activities which do not appear in the national statistics.

A defined minimum service of a specified quality available to all users and consumers in the Union and, taking into account specific national conditions, at an affordable price. Not to be confused with "services of general interest" or "public service".
Training provided for those workers no longer familiar with technical progress in order to update their skills.
Use for the growth of cities, both in number of inhabitants and in territorial extent, and for the consequences of this growth on the way of life.
Use for the conditions of actual use of the various official languages.
Use only for the State which existed until the break-up of the Soviet Union.
Intentional, needless damage and destruction, especially of public buildings and places.
This comes from the application of a flat rate to the VAT base of each Member State.
Credit facilities arranged between the central banks to allow interventions in Community currencies.

Philosophical and historical perspective of a united Europe.
Training aimed at providing the skills, knowledge and aptitudes required for carrying out a task which is different from the previous one.
Activities which aim at providing the skills, knowledge and aptitudes required for employment in a particular occupation (or a group of related occupations) in any field of economic activity.
Procedure in France whereby the government can force the Assembly to vote on the whole text under discussion, allowing only those amendments proposed or accepted by itself.
Votes validly cast excluding blank and invalid ballot papers.
Use for the respect of voting instructions given to parliamentarians by their party or parliamentary group.

A person who works for a public or private employer and receives wages, salaries, room and board or other compensation for his efforts. Use in the case of professions, otherwise in a more general context use the descriptor "labour force".

Alleanza militari (1955-1991) li kienet tgħaqqad flimkien ma' l-Unjoni Sovjetika, lill-Albanija (sa l-1968), ir-Repubblika Demokratika tal-Ġermanja, il-Bulgarija, l-Ungerija, il-Polonja, ir-Rumanija u ċ-Ċekoslovakkja.
The reprocessing of the waste materials originating during a production process to obtain similar or other products than the original material.
Energy produced by the movement of waves.
Internet user.
Society in which welfare and social security are provided by the State through its departments and agencies.
Centralised market which simplifies distribution channels by reducing the number of middlemen between producers and consumers.
Contract between an employer and an individual employee.
Only to be used for documents of a very general nature, otherwise choose a more specific descriptor.
The excess of current assets over current liabilities, representing the funds available for financing business activities.
Physical, social and managerial factors affecting a worker's job.
The working poor are households with an income below the poverty line.
All persons already gainfully employed or who declare themselves to be seeking employment.
Use for the drafting of administrative documents.

Ir-Repubblika Soċjalista Federali magħmula minn sitt repubbliki (il-Bożnja-Herzegovina, il-Kroazja, il-Maċedonja, il-Montenegro, is-Serbja u s-Slovenja) mil-ewwel Gwerra Dinjija sax-xoljiment tal-federazzjoni fl-1991.
Infectious disease of animals which can be transmitted to humans.
The science concerned with the domestication and breeding of animals.
L-enċefalopatija sponġiformi bovini (BSE) hija marda li tolqot il-moħħ bovin. Għall-varjanti umana, uża "marda tas-sistema nervuża".
Netwerk ta' informazzjoni dwar l-edukazzjoni fl-Ewropa.

Imħaddma mill-organizzazzjoni intergovernattiva Eutelsat maħluqa fl-1977 biex tmexxi infrastruttura ta' telekomunikazzjonijiet bis-satellita fl-Ewropa. F'Lulju 2001, l-attivitajiet tal-Eutelsat ġew trasferiti lejn soċjetà ta' dritt privat.
Assoċjazzjoni informali, xolta fl-1994, ta' ministri tad-difiża tal-pajjiżi Ewropej fil-qafas tan-NATO.
Proċess ta' integrazzjoni tad-dinamiżmu politiku u ekonomiku tal-UE fit-tfassil tal-politiki nazzjonali.
The non-collection of duties under the Common Customs Tariff in the case of goods imported for personal use or by private individuals.
Use only in cases where EAGGF is understood in a general sense without distinguishing between Guidance and Guarantee Sections.
L-EGF jimmira li jgħin ħaddiema li spiċċaw qiegħda, minħabba t-tibdil fix-xejriet tal-kummerċ dinji, biex isibu xogħol ieħor malajr kemm jista' jkun.
Set up under the Treaty of Rome to improve employment chances for workers in the internal market and contribute to the raising of living standards.
When referring to customs, use customs formalities.
Ftehim bejn żewġ Stati, li weħidhom huma marbuta li josservaw il-klawżoli tal-ftehim, li l-vantaġġi tagħhom is-soltu ma jgawdux minnhom pajjiżi terzi.
Ftehim konkluż b'mod konġunt mill-Istati Membri u l-Komunitajiet Ewropej fl-oqsma ta' kompetenzi maqsuma.
Applikazzjoni provviżorja tal-ftehim tal-KE. Għaqqad ma' "Ftehim ta' Assoċjazzjoni", "Ftehim Kummerċjali" jew "Ftehim ta' kooperazzjoni".
Use in association with country concerned.
Il-qafas istituzzjonali tal-kooperazzjoni monetarja tal-pajjiżi tal-Organizzazzjoni Ewropea għall-Kooperazzjoni Eknomika mill-1958 sa l-1972.
Ftehim iffirmat bejn l-Istati Membri tal-Unjoni Ewropea u l-pajjiżi terzi jew l-organizzazzjonijiet internazzjonali fl-oqsma ta' kompetenza tagħhom
Process of growing economic integration of the world economy.
Maħluq fl-1973 mill-ministri tal-affarijiet barranin tal-Messiku, il-Venezwela, il-Kolombja u l-Panama, dan il-grupp ġie integrat fil-Grupp ta' Rio fl-1987. Uża Grupp ta' Rio.
Grupp tas-seba' pajjiżi l-aktar industrijalizzati (l-Istati Uniti, il-Ġappun, il-Ġermanja, Franza, l-Italja, ir-Renju Unit u l-Kanada). Fl-1998, daħlet ir-Russja u sar il-"Grupp tat-Tmienja".
Organizzazzjoni permanenti ta' konsultazzjoni politika għall-pajjiżi tal-Amerika Latina u tal-Karibew, li rriżultat mill-fużjoni tal-Grupp ta' Contadora u l-Grupp ta' Lima fl-1986.
Maħluq fl-01/01/2007, ir-reġjun jiġbor flimkien il-kontej l-antiki ta' Copenhagen u Frederiksborg, il-muniċipalitajiet ta' Copenhagen u Frederiksberg kif ukoll il-muniċipalità reġjonali ta' Bornholm.
Ġabra ta' ideat mibnija madwar il-kunċett ta' nazzjon u li jidentifikaw individwi jew kollettivitajiet ma' dawn l-ideat.

Il-G-10 jirrappreżenta l-ministri tal-finanzi u l-gvernaturi tal-banek ċentrali tal-pajjiżi l-aktar industrijalizzati fil-Fond Monetarju Industrijali (IMF). Magħmul mill-pajjiżi tal-"Grupp tas-Sebgħa", il-Belġju, l-Olanda u l-Iżvezja.
Organizzazzjoni ta' kooperazzjoni reġjonali li tinkludi l-Kenja, l-Uganda u t-Tanżanija.
Refers to the part of Oceania situated in the North Pacific, comprising some 2000 islands. For the country, use the descriptor "Federated States of Micronesia".

Pajjiżi tal-Ewropa Ċentrali u tal-Lvant assoċjati ma' l-UE bi ftehimiet ta' assoċjazzjoni. Tmien pajjiżi ssieħbu fl-Unjoni Ewropea fl-2004 (l-Estonja, l-Ungerija, il-Latvja, il-Litwanja, il-Polonja, ir-Repubblika Ċeka, is-Slovakkja u s-Slovenja) u tnejn oħra fl-2007 (il-Bulgarija u r-Rumanija). Fl-2007, il-lista ta' pajjiżi PECO kienet tiġbor flimkien lill-Albanija, il-Bożnja-Herzegovina, il-Kroazja, dik li kienet ir-Repubblika Jugożlava tal-Maċedonja, il-Kosovo, il-Montenegro u s-Serbja.

Organu ġudizzjarju ewlieni tan-NU, il-Qorti Internazzjonali tal-Ġustizzja tirregola, skond id-dritt internazzjonali, il-varjazzjonijiet fl-ordni ġuridiku li jeżistu bejn l-Istati u li huma sottomessi lilha mill-Istati stess jew tagħti pariri konsultattivi dwar il-kwistonijiet ġuridiċi li jistgħu jitolbuha l-organi jew l-aġenziji tan-NU awtorizzati li jagħmlu dan. M'għandhiex tiġi konfuża mat-'Tribunal Internazzjonali għar-Rwanda jew għall-ex Jugożlavja' jew mal-Qorti Kriminali Internazzjonali
Use for the Federal Republic of Germany since the end of the Second World War and for the whole of Germany since reunification on 3 October 1990.
The holding of an employment over and above the basic job, usually in breach of rules laid down by the law.

Assoċjazzjoni ta' impriżi jew ta' persuni fiżiċi imwaqqfa sabiex twettaq proġett preċiż. Skond ir-regoli Komunitarji tal-kompetizzjoni, l-impriżi konġunti huma impriżi kkontrollati b'mod konġunt minn mill-inqas żewġ impriżi. Fil-prattika, il-kunċett ikopri bosta tipi ta' operazzjonijiet, mill-fużjoni għall-kooperazzjoni f'attivitajiet speċifiċi, bħar-riċerka u l-iżvilupp, il-produzzjoni u d-distribuzzjoni.
Fir-rigward tal-inseminazzjoni artifiċjali tal-bnedmin, uża 'prokreazzjoni artifiċjali'
Science and policies relative to the construction and organisation of towns.

Fl-4 ta' Frar 2003, il-Komunità tal-Istati tas-Serbja u l-Montenegro ħadu post ir-Repubblika Federali tal-Jugożlavja, iddikjarata fis-27 ta' April 1992. Fit-3 ta' Ġunju 2006, il-Montenegro ddikjara l-indipendenza tiegħu u l-Istat Federali nqasam f'żewġ stati indipendenti ġodda: ir-Repubblika tas-Serbja u r-Repubblika tal-Montenegro.
Ir-ratifika għadha pendenti.

It-Tribunal Kriminali Internazzjonali għandu l-ħila li jgħaddi ġudizzju fuq persuni li huma preżunti responsabbli ta' ksur gravi tad-dritt internazzjonali umanitarju li sar fuq territorju ddefinit (per eżempju. “It-Tribunal Kriminali Internazzjonali għal dik li kienet il-Jugożlavja”, “It-Tribunal Kriminali għall-Irwanda”). Ma għandux ikun imħawwad mal-“Qorti Kriminali Internazzjonali” jew il-“Qorti Internazzjonali tal-Ġustizzja”.
M' għandhiex tiġi konfuża ma' "president ta' istituzzjoni".
Imfassla fl-1948 biex twaqqaf organizzazzjoni internazzjonali tal-kummerċ. Qatt ma daħlet fis-seħħ.

Maħluqa fl-1994, il-Komunità Ekonomika u Monetarja tal-Afrika Ċentrali (CAEMC) assorbiet l-attivitajiet tal-Unjoni Monetarja Ċentru Afrikana (CAMU jew Żona Monetarja Ċentru Afrikana) u ta' Unjoni Doganali u Ekonomika Ċentru Afrikana (CACEU). Tħaddan fiha l-Kamerun, ir-Repubblika Ċentru Afrikana, il-Gabon, il-Ginea Ekwatorjali u ċ-Ċad u hija kkaratterizzata mill-għarfien tal-istess munita (il-franc CFA).
Maħluqa fl-1 ta' Novembru 2006, ħadet post il-Konfederazzjoni Dinjija tax-Xogħol u l-Konfederazzjoni Internazzjonali tat-Trade Unions Ħielsa
Grupp temporanju ta' impriżi indipendenti imwaqqaf għat-twettiq ta' operazzjoni finanzjarja jew ekonomika.

Kunċett storiku li jirrappreżenta l-kooperazzjoni fil-qasam tal-ġustizzja u tal-affarijiet interni, integrat bħala konsegwenza fil-ftehim ta' Schengen imbagħad fil-qafas istituzzjonali tal-Unjoni Ewropea. Uża "AFSJ" (Żona ta' libertà, sigurtà u ġustizzja).

Proġett ta koordinazzjoni tal-politiki barranin bejn l-Istati Membri; xolt fis-snin sebgħin. L-EPC ġie integrat fit-Trattat dwar l-Unjoni Ewropea u uffiċjalizzat mill-"politika barranija ta' sigurtà komuni.

Grupp ta' ħidma intergovernattiv li jieħu ħsieb, mill-1976, kwistjonijiet rilevanti għat-terroriżmu u s-sigurtà interna (Grupp TREVI). Fl-1985, il-kompetenzi tiegħu ġew estiżi għall-immigrazzjoni illegali u l-kriminalità organizzata. Fl-1989, il-gruppi tal-ħidma teigħu kienu erbgħa (terroriżmu, kooperazzjoni bejn il-pulizija, kriminalità organizzata, moviment ħieles tal-persuni), ikkontrollati minn grupp ta' uffiċjali għolja inkarigati mit-tħejjija tad-deċiżjonijiet adottati mill-Kunsill.
Ġabra ta' valuri, tradizzjonijiet, attitudnijiet u strateġiji marbuta mal-mod kif issir il-politika.

Kummissjoni reġjonali tal-Kumitat Ekonomiku u Soċjali tan-Nazzjonijiet Uniti (Ecosoc) li tagħti bidu għal miżuri biex jitħeġġeġ l-iżvilupp ekonomiku reġjonali u ssaħħaħ ir-relazzjonijiet ekonomiċi tal-pajjiżi.
A company which exists for the primary or sole purpose of holding controlling interests in other companies.
Assembly of the Heads of State or Heads of Government of the European Union's Member States.

Organizzazzjoni li m'għadhiex attiva maħluqa fl-14 ta' Ġunju 1966 mill-gvernijiet tal-Awstralja, il-Ġappun, il-Korea t' Isfel, il-Vjetnam tan-Nofsinhar, ir-Repubblika tal-Korea, il-Malażja, New Zealand u l-Filippini. Ġiet xolta fl-1975 wara nuqqas ta' qbil bejn il-membri tagħha dwar l-għarfien tar-Repubblika Popolari taċ-Ċina.

Forum politiku għall-kooperazzjoni reġjonali u intergovernattiva fost 11-il pajjiż tar-reġjun tal-Baħar Baltiku (id-Danimarka, l-Estonja, il-Finlandja, il-Ġermanja, l-Iżlanda, il-Latvja, il-Litwanja, in-Norveġja, il-Polonja, ir-Russja, l-Iżvezja) u l-Kummissjoni Ewropea.
The European Union's main decision-making institution. Consists of the ministers of the Member States responsible for the items on the agenda.

Ħadet post il-Kunsill għall-Kooperazzjoni Nord-Atlantika fl-1997. Tgħaqqad il-pajjizi membri u l-pajjiżi sħab tan-NATO fi ħdan kuntest li jippermetilhom jiddjalogawu jikkonsultaw ma' xulxin dwar kwistjonijiet ta' politika u ta' sigurtà.

L-Arranġament ta' Wassenaar rigward il-kontroll multilaterali ta' esportazzjonijiet għall-armi konvenzjonali u prodotti u teknoloġiji b'użu doppju sar wara l-COCOM (il-Kumitat ta' Koordinament għall-Kontroll multilaterali ta' esportazzjonijiet) fl-1996.
A State in Oceania comprising more than 600 islands in the archipelago of the Caroline Islands, with four constituent States: Chuuk, Kosrae, Pohnpei and Yap.
Use for documents which deal with all of these countries.
Il-ġabra ta' atti normattivi adottati mill-istituzzjonijiet Ewropej f'applikazzjoni tad-dispożizzjonijiet tat-Trattati.
Special Administrative Region of China since 20 December 1999.
Għall-varjanti annimali, uża BSE
Metodu istituzzjonali li juża l-mekkaniżmi tal-ewwel pilastru tal-UE, bil-kontra tal-metodu tal-kooperazzjoni intergovernattiva użat mill-pilastri l-oħra.
To be used for social aspects of death and attitudes towards death.
Maħluq fl-01/01/2007, ir-reġjun jiġbor flimkien il-kontej l-antiki ta' Ringkjøbing u ta' Århus kif ukoll parti mill-kontej ta' Viborg u ta' Vejle.
Forza tal-Pulizija stabbilita fil-qafas tal-ESDP li tieħu sehem f'operazzjonijiet internazzjonali ta' ġestjoni ċivili ta' kriżi u għall-prevenzjoni ta' kunflitti.
Maħluq fl-01/01/2007, ir-reġjun jiġbor flimkien il-kontea l-antika tat-Tramuntana ta' Jutland u parti mill-kontea ta' Viborg.
Organizzazzjoni maħluqa f'Ġunju 1966 f'Tananarivo u xolta fil-25 ta' Marzu 1985. Dawn l-attivitajiet huma integrati fl-Organizzazzjoni għall-Unità Afrikana, li saret l-Unjoni Afrikana fl-2002.

Intervent ta' awtorità pubblika, mibni madwar valuri u għanijiet, bil-għan tat-trasformazzjoni tas-soċjetà għaż-żmien mezzan u għat-tul, permezz ta' mezzi u azzjonijiet varji. Ordni pubbliku jiġi applikat fil-qasam ta' kompetenza tal-awtorità li teżerċitah.
Maħluqa fl-1952 bl-isem Kunsill għall-Kooperazzjoni Doganali, l-organizzazzjoni adottat l-isem uffiċjali tagħha fl-1994.
Maħluqa fl-1924 bl-isem ta' Uffiċju Internazzjonali għall-Mard tal-Annimali, l-organizzazzjoni adottat l-isem uffiċjali tagħha fl-2003.
Terminu ġeneriku li jgħaqqad tliet organiżmi Ewropej tal-istandardizzar (CEN, Cenelec u ETSI). Uża ma' kull entità speċifika.
Trattat ta' alleanza militari ffirmat fl-1955 u li kien jgħaqqad l-Istati Komunisti tal-Ewropa taħt l-influwenza tal-Unjoni Sovjetika. Ġie xolt fl-1991.
Kumpanija mhux reġistrata, mingħajr personalità morali jew ġuridika, mhux pubblika u li tista' tkun moħbija.
Pjan għall-iżvilupp ekonomiku u soċjali kooperattiv fl-Ażja u l-Paċifiku.
M'għandhiex tiġi konfuża ma' "kap ta' Stat".

Qorti indipendenti permanenti li quddiema jiġu ġġudikati persuni mixlija bl-aktar delitti gravi li jaffettwaw lill-komunità internazzjonali, bħall-ġenoċidju, id-delitti kontra l-umanità u d-delitti tal-gwerra. M'għandux jiġi konfuż mat-Tribunal Kriminali Internazzjonali (għar-Rwanda u l-ex-Jugożlavja) u l-Qorti Internazzjonali tal-Ġustizzja tan-Nazzjonaijiet Uniti li tirregola essenzjalment id-differenzi bejn l-Istati.
Organizzazzjoni ta' skambji internazzjonali msejsa fuq ftehim dirett bejn żewġ Stati.
Organizzazzjoni ta' relazzjonijiet imsejsa fuq mekkaniżmi li jippermettu li jiġu privileġġjati r-rapporti ta' kull wieħed mill-pajjiżi ma' l-imsieħba kollha.
Għaqqad ma' "maġistrat mhux professjonist" għar-rikuża ta' ġurat, "xhieda" għar-rikuża ta' xhud, jew "mħallef" għar-rikuża ta' mħallef.
Fir-rigward tal-prokreazzjoni artifiċjali tal-annimali, uża 'inseminazzjoni artifiċjali'
An area of land that is protected and managed in order to preserve a particular type of habitat and its flora and fauna which are often rare or endangered.
Alleanza difensiva mwaqqfa fit-8 ta' Settembru 1954 bejn l-Awstralja, l-Istati Uniti, Franza, il-Gran Brittanja, New Zealand, il-Pakistan, il-Filippini u t-Tajlandja. Ġiet xolta fl-1977.
Ħadet post l-Organizzazzjoni tal-Istati tal-Amerika Ċentrali fl-1991 sabiex twaqqaf is-suq komuni tal-Amerika Ċentrali.
Maħluq fl-01/01/2007, ir-reġjun jiġbor flimkien il-kontej l-antiki ta' Roskilde, ta' Storstrøm u ta' Vestsjælland.
Ħlas ta' sussidji Ewropej marbuta mat-tħaddim u mhux mal-produzzjoni

Ġabra ta' movimenti u assoċjazzjonijiet b'għan mhux ta' qligħ, indipendenti mill-Istat, bil-għan li jittrasformaw il-politiki, in-normi u l-istrutturi soċjali, fuq livell nazzjonali jew internazzjonali.
Expenses incurred by a business other than direct manufacturing costs.
Żona ta' skambji preferenzjali bejn l-Istati tal-Afrika tal-Lvant u l-Afrika tan-Nofsinhar.
Maħluq fl-01/01/2007, ir-reġjun jiġbor flimkien il-kontej l-antiki ta' Fyns, Ribe u Sønderjylland (Sud Jutland) kif ukoll parti mill-kontea ta' Vejle.
Taric is used by the Commission and the Member States for the purpose of applying Community measures relating to imports and exports and to trade between Member States.
Skada f'Lulju 2002.
Use specific terms.
Kamra ġurisdizzjonali marbuta mal-Qorti tal-Prim' Istanza tal-Komunitajiet Ewropej biex tiddeċiedi dwar tilwim fir-rigward taċ-ċivil tal-Unjoni Ewropea.
Trade-related investment measures.
Trade-related aspects of intellectual property rights.

Tip ta' turiżmu pprattikat fir-reġjuni naturali u ftit li xejn mimsusa mill-bniedem sabiex tiġi ammirata l-bijodiversità u l-manifestazzjonijiet kulturali, titgħallem tipproteġi l-ambjent u tikkontribwixxi għall-ħarsien tal-fawna u l-flora.

Tip ta' turiżmu li jiffavorixxi l-ħarsien u l-valorizzazzjoni tal-ambjent naturali, kulturali u tal-bniedem. Jirreferi għal kunċetti ta' żvilupp sostenibbli u jwassal għal benefiċċji soċjoekonomiċi għall-komunitajiet lokali u reġjonali.
Segretarjat tal-Organizzazzjoni Internazzjonali tax-Xogħol (ILO).
Programm komuni dwar l-HIV u l-AIDS appoġġat min-Nazzjonijiet Uniti.
Organizzazzjoni panafrikana li ħadet post l-Organizzazzjoni għall-Unità Afrikana fid-9 ta' Lulju 2002. Tħaddan il-pajjiżi Afrikani kollha, inkluża s-Saħara tal-Punent, minbarra l-Marokk.
Ħadet post il- Komunità Ekonomika tal-Afrika tal-Punent (WAEC) u l-Unjoni Ekonomika u Monetarja tal-Afrika tal-Punent (WAEMU).
Maħluqa fl-1950 minn tmintax-il pajjiż membru tal-Organizzazzjoni Ewropea tal-Kooperazzjoni Ekonomika, ġiet xolta f'Diċembru tal-1958 u ssostitwita mill-Ftehim Monetarju Ewropew.
Organizzazzjoni maħluqa fl-2001 bil-fużjoni tal-Unjoni Internazzjonali tan-Navigazzjoni fuq ix-Xmajjar u l-Konsorzju Internazzjonali tan-Navigazzjoni fuq ir-Renu.

Oriġinarjament, konsultazzjoni informali bejn l-Istati Membri sabiex ifasslu pożizzjonijiet konkreti u jimplimentaw, flimkien, politika barranija Ewropea. Uffiċjalizzata mit-Trattat tal-Unjoni Ewropea, din ġiet issostitwita mill-politika barranija u tas-sigurtà komuni.

Fil-qafas tad-dispożizzjonijiet tal-ftehim ta' Cotonou, ir-riżorsi u l-attivitajiet taċ-Ċentru għall-Iżvilupp tal-Industrija (CDI) ġew ittrasferiti liċ-Ċentru għall-Iżvilupp tal-Intrapriża (CDE) f'Awwissu 2000.
Xjenza li tistudja l-forma, il-qisien u l-qasam ta' gravitazzjoni tad-dinja.
Use for assets derived from an illicit activity, such as drug trafficking.
Ħatra ta' membri ta' istituzzjoni jew organu tal-Unjoni Ewropea, aġenzija jew korp Komunitarju. Għaqqad ma' l-istituzzjonijiet, l-organu, l-aġenzija, jew il-korp speċifiku.
Obligation to provide financial support for a parent or relative.
Ir-Reġjun Amministrattiv Speċjali ta' Ħong Kong tar-Repubblika Popolari taċ-Ċina.

Tgħaqqad l-attivitajiet tal-ewwel (moviment ħieles tal-persuni, kenn politiku, immigrazzjoni, viża, kooperazzjoni ġudizzjarja ċivili) u t-tielet pilastri (kooperazzjoni tal-pulizija u ġudizzjarja kriminali).
